intro: Parnassia chengkouensis, commonly known as the Chengkou Parnassia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it has a short, hairy stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
